header.h2: Watch "The Bizarre Zone" Student Film Project

img.alt: black and white movie cover of bizarre zone
img.title: movie cover

div.class: fsDiv fsStyleTwoThirds fsStyleColumn fsStyleColumn-2 fsStyleColumn-last fsStyleAutoclear

div.p:
Creating The Bizarre Zone short film:
Solano County Office of Education partnered with North Bay Regional Center, and Inclusion Films, founded by veteran filmmaker Joey Travolta, to bring a film making camp to young adults with developmental disabilities. Forty-eight young adults from across Solano County spent two weeks on set practicing scripts, finding their marks, and helping to create a great movie.
Good Day Sacramento- Red Carpet Kickoff from Solano COE on Vimeo.

p.a: Learn More About College and Career Readiness

a.data-page-name: Quality Counts in Solano Early Care & Education

img.alt: Napa and Solano Counties Central Labor Council
US Office of Special Education Programs

div.p: $5.7m in grant funding has been awarded to Solano COE to provide educator training, school based social-emotional support services, support for homeless students, support for students in job-readiness skills development, and youth development activities and training including tobacco use prevention, civic engagement, and citizenship

Attendance Matters Raise the awareness of school personnel, parents, guardians, caregivers, community partners, and local business of the effects of chronic absenteeism and truancy and other challenges associated with poor attendance. Attendance Awareness Resources

Early Learning system is a collaboration of stakeholders working with children ages 0-5 years and connects parents and educational community providers with resources, including specialized training and coaching support, with the goal of increasing the quality of early learning throughout Solano County.
71% of our Solano County schools have been trained in Positive Behavoir Intervention Supports (PBIS)

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_5

img.alt: Solano County 2018 Attendance Awareness Public Service Announcement (PSA)/Poster Contest Winners!

div.a: Solano County 2018 Attendance Awareness Public Service Announcement (PSA)/Poster Contest Winners!

p.span: The Solano County Office of Education (SCOE) is pleased to announce the winners of their 2018 Attendance Awareness Public Service Announcement (PSA)/Poster Contest

article.a: Read More about Solano County 2018 Attendance Awareness Public Service Announcement (PSA)/Poster Contest Winners!

img.alt: Solanos Stuff the Bus Backpack Drive Success

div.a: Solanos Stuff the Bus Backpack Drive Success

div.p: This years countywide Stuff the Bus campaign, held June 28 July 28, 2018, proved to be another huge success. Backpacks continued to arrive through mid-September. Due to this outpouring of our local community, we were able to collect 761 backpacks for our homeless and foster youth, an increase from the 312 backpacks collected in 2017. We appreciate the commitment from our Solano County community partners. Together we are working to create opportunities for our deserving youth, says Solano County Superintendent of Schools Lisette Estrella-Henderson.

article.a: Read More about Solanos Stuff the Bus Backpack Drive Success

img.alt: County Superintendent of Schools to Receive Woman of the Year Award

div.a: County Superintendent of Schools to Receive Woman of the Year Award

p.span: The Solano County Office of Education (SCOE) is pleased to announce that Lisette Estrella-Henderson, Solano County Superintendent of Schools, has been selected as one of U.S. Congressman John Garamendis 2018 Women of the Year. The annual awards publicly honor outstanding women of the third Congressional District encompassing eight counties Colusa, Glenn, Lake, Sacramento, Solano, Sutter, Yolo, and Yuba. Women are recognized for improving the quality of life in the Third District through their work and volunteerism.

article.a: Read More about County Superintendent of Schools to Receive Woman of the Year Award

img.alt: Solano County Office of Education Adult Transition Students KTXL Fox40 News Interview with Filmmaker Joey Travolta

div.a: Solano County Office of Education Adult Transition Students KTXL Fox40 News Interview with Filmmaker Joey Travolta

p.span: COE Adult Transition students, Zachary Herman and Sean Kielberg, had the opportunity to work with movie maker Joey Travolta of Inclusion Films at a camp in Stockton. The team had an interview on XTXL FOX40 News and shared their experiences. Mr. Travolta started Inclusion Films in 2007 which teaches individuals with development disabilities in five dedicated production studios throughout California. Mr. Travoltas film crew travels the country doing short film camps for children and teens with autism.

article.a: Read More about Solano County Office of Education Adult Transition Students KTXL Fox40 News Interview with Filmmaker Joey Travolta

img.alt: Solano County Office of Education Hosts UC Davis C-STEM Girls in Robotics Leadership (GIRL) Camps

div.a: Solano County Office of Education Hosts UC Davis C-STEM Girls in Robotics Leadership (GIRL) Camps

p.span: The Solano County Office of Education (SCOE) is partnering with UC Davis Computing-Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (C-STEM) to bring Girls in Robotics Leadership (GIRL) Camps to Solano County for free.
These camps are focused on introducing and motivating middle school girls to learn computing and STEM concepts through a fun and robotics-based curriculum.

article.a: Read More about Solano County Office of Education Hosts UC Davis C-STEM Girls in Robotics Leadership (GIRL) Camps

div.p: The California School Dashboard provides parents and educators with meaningful information on school and district progress so they can participate in decisions to improve student learning.

The Solano County Office of Education is committed to advancing career education and workforce development in Solano County. Toward that end, we are pleased to launch the Solano County K-12 Connect2Careers Continuum.
